title: House prices grow at slowest pace for six years as uncertainty saps market
text:
House prices are rising at their slowest rate for more than six years as the market is hammered by Brexit turmoil, according to lender Halifax.

Annual house prices were just 1.1pc higher in September than they had been a year earlier, the worst performance since April 2013. The average UK property cost £232,574, 0.4pc lower than August.

Russell Galley, managing director of Halifax, said: “Looking ahead, we expect activity levels and price growth to remain subdued while the current period of economic uncertainty persists.”

The gloomy Halifax index, which has been revamped this summer amid concerns over its reliability, adds to the welter of evidence that suggests the property market is slowing...
description: House prices are rising at their slowest rate for more than six years as the market is hammered by Brexit turmoil, according to lender Halifax.
